modName: Lind's Brown Robes Revamp - Texture Replacer
summary:
High quality fully redesigned textures for the Brown long Mage robes, Hood and Robes available in 2048x2048.

Installation: Simply Unzip and copy the Data folder in your Skyrim directory.
descriptionHtml:
[center]-----------------------------------------------------------
[b][size=4]Description:[/size][/b]
-----------------------------------------------------------[/center]
[b]

This is a texture replacer for the Brown long robes (Male and Female) featuring 2048x2048 textures for both the robes and the hood
Installation: Simply Unzip and copy the Data folder in your Skyrim directory.
The .dds files should end up into Data/textures/clothes/monk

If you have skimpy meshes installed and want to use these robes, I suggest installing either exeter's or calientes' adaptation.

Also compatible with high poli meshes (why wouldn't they be, uh?).[/b]

Overwrite if asked.

[img]http://s18.postimg.org/gnyqvvwll/Tumblr_Lind.jpg[/img][/url]

For those of you who don't fancy Tumblr, [url=https://twitter.com/LindsRealm] I just made this.

[img]https://s24.postimg.org/qey3j9tp1/Twitter.png[/img][/url][url=http://lindsworkshop.tumblr.com/][/url][/center]

[center] -----------------------------------------------------------
[b][size=4]More Informations:[/size][/b]
-----------------------------------------------------------

So as usual to keep lore friendly-ness I did a bit of research before starting the brown ones, found out not a single person in vanilla skyrim wears the brown ones. So I went on the nexus and Reddit and looked up what people usually use them for:

Apparently, people playing some sort of wandering wizard-things were using the brown robes, that, and if you start as a Warlock's thrall in LAL, you start the game wearing these robes.

Result: I need to make some kind of robes that look worn, ruined, acient, perhaps even dating back to the dwemer, since brown seemed to be in fashion amongst the dwarves.

-----------------------------------------------------------
[b][size=4]Features over Vanilla[/size][/b]
-----------------------------------------------------------[/center]

The new textures have overall improved overall visuals:
-Twice the original resolution (2k).
-Completely re-made and recoloured.
-Chains!
-General shading and 3d effects.
-Added layered effects.
-A cloth-like pattern covers the robes in order to give it a more realistic feeling.
-Re-shaded/coloured to give a worn-like feeling
-Added various ornaments and decorations.
-Remade the rope-belt
-High resolution makes the texture very hard to deform.
